bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Procedures relating to bylaws and rules

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: bylaws under section 84 (2) (b) and (c) of the Act, and
rules under section 86 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: At least 30 days before making the bylaw or rule, the real estate council must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: notify licensees of the proposed bylaw or rule in accordance with subsection (7),
provide them with an opportunity to comment on the proposed bylaw or rule, and
send to the minister and the superintendent a copy of the information referred to in subsection (7).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: After the minimum period established by subsection (2) has passed, the real estate council may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make the bylaw or rule as proposed,
make the bylaw or rule with editing changes that do not substantively alter the effect of the bylaw or rule, or
withdraw the proposed bylaw or rule.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (3) (b), a change in the proposed effective date of the bylaw or rule does not substantively alter the effect of the bylaw or rule if the new effective date is a later date than that originally proposed.
In order to make a rule, the real estate council must do this by a vote of not less than 3/4 of the number of members set for the real estate council.
As soon as practicable after making the bylaw or rule, the real estate council must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: notify licensees, in accordance with subsection (7), and
send to the minister and the superintendent a copy of the information referred to in that subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notification to licensees under subsection (2) or (6) must provide

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the wording of the proposed bylaw or rule, or the adopted bylaw or rule, as applicable, and
an explanation of its purpose and intended effect.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notification to licensees required under this section may be effected by publication on the real estate council's web site.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: grandparented manufactured home dealer means a person who was, on December 31, 2004, exempt under the Motor Dealer Exemption Regulation, B.C. Reg. 189/88, from Part 1 of the Real Estate Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 397;
